ygData.subject: Re: /commands
ygData.msgSnippet: Thats not really a new command .. its been avaliable since the final beta. Comes in handy when you want to loot your corpse in a dangerous area.  Find someone
ygData.messageBody:
Thats not really a new command .. its been avaliable since the final beta.
Comes in handy when you want to loot your corpse in a dangerous area. Find
someone to make you invisible and use the /corpse command over and over,
till you can drag it to a safe area allowing you to loot it safely.

The only other command that i can think of is the /pet sit down command. I
never found it in the book for some reason. ( maybe its just me ) That
command lets you place your pet in a spot where it will just rest. It will
not attack other creatures around you unless you are attacked. Rememeber to
tell it to follow you when you are ready to go, or it will just sit there..
hehe


Lance

-----Original Message-----
From: Rich.Hitz@... [mailto:Rich.Hitz@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 20, 1999 11:07 AM
To: EverQuest@onelist.com
Subject: [EverQuest] /commands


From: Rich.Hitz@...

I have only been playing EQ for a few weeks and
have found a /command that is not in the
text files that come with the game.

/corpse:
summons your corpse from a few yards away.
This is useful if your corpse is underneath the
NPC/creature that killed you, or if you want to
loot yourself in a less high traffic area.

Is there anyone out there that can tell me more
commands that are not in the list?

Thanks.

Mytheril,
Druid of Tunare
2nd Tier
